episodes.title: Blood, Bones and Relics - A Macabre Tour of Canterbury and the Blood Drinking Cult of Thomas Becket
episodes.description:
In this video, Jessica the Museum Guide (that’s me!) takes you on a detailed guided tour of the darkest corners of Canterbury's history - we're talking saints' relics, blood-drinking cults, murdered archbishops and more.  

👉🏻Don’t forget to like, comment, and subscribe. Leave a comment and let me know your thoughts!

👉🏻Join me for exclusive content ONLY on my Patreon: www.patreon.com/themuseumguide - an extra video every single month, and invitations to free in-person tours. In April, it was a video of Rouen’s 19th-Century Gothic Museums, and May is a tour of the Pirates Exhibit at the Maritime Museum. 

 👉🏻As always, thanks for watching. If you enjoyed this virtual museum tour, then please consider leaving me a tip at www.paypal.me/jessicatourguide or buy me a coffee at https://www.buymeacoffee.com/JessicaGuide

👉🏻Remember – I guide private museum, oddities, and graveyard tours in London and Canterbury. Get in touch at jessica@themuseumguide.com


VIDEO SUMMARY

0:00 - Introduction to the tour
  - St Dunstan and the Devil
 - Thomas More's Severed Head
- Murder Holes at the Westgate
- St Alphege, Beaten to Death with Oxbones
- Simon Sudbury's Severed Head
- Thomas Cranmer, Burnt at the Stake
- The Beheading of William Laud
- The Murder of St Thomas Becket
- The Blood Cult of St Thomas Becket
- The Ducking Stool and Swimming Witches
- The Canterbury Martyrs Monument
